intro: Resinanthus montecristinus, commonly known as the Montecristi resin tree, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador. It is characterized by its large, glossy leaves and produces a unique, aromatic resin that has been used traditionally by indigenous communities. The plant belongs to the family Burseraceae, which includes other resin-producing trees such as frankincense and myrrh. Its ecological significance lies in its role as a habitat for various insects and birds, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystem.
